intro: Acleisanthes purpusiana, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh desert conditions. Its leaves are usually small and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The fruit is a dry capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in its native habitat.
